required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Single Center, Open-label, Non-randomized, Non-placebo-controlled Study to Investigate the Metabolism, Excretion Pattern, Mass Balance, Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics After Single Intravenous Administration of 12 mg [14C]Copanlisib (BAY 80-6946) in Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to provide understanding of the relative relevance of the different excretion pathways of Copanlisib in humans, as well as to characterize its metabolite profile.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of copanlisib in plasma by maximum concentration (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of copanlisib in plasma by area under the measured matrix concentration versus time curve from the first time point (t=0) extrapolated to infinity (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of copanlisib in plasma by area under the measured matrix concentration versus time curve to the last data point above the lower limit of quantitation (AUC(0-tlast))
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of total radioactivity in plasma by Cmax
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of total radioactivity in plasma by AUC
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of total radioactivity in plasma by AUC(0-tlast)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of total radioactivity in whole blood by Cmax
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of total radioactivity in whole blood by AUC
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of total radioactivity in whole blood by AUC(0-tlast)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Radioactivity excreted in urine as a percentage of the dose (AE,ur)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Radioactivity excreted in feces as a percentage of the dose (AE,fec)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 336 hours
Multiple time points up to 336 hours
Multiple time points up to 336 hours
Multiple time points up to 336 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until 30 days after study drug administration

intervention.description: Intravenous infusion of 12 mg copanlisib labeled with 2.76 MBq (75 μCi) of [14C]

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male subject
- Age: 45 to 65 years
- Body weight greater or equal to 60 kg and body mass index (BMI): above/equal 18 and below/equal 30 kg/m²
Exclusion Criteria:
- Regular use of medicines
- Known recent (last 2 years) abuse of recreational drugs, suspicion of drug or alcohol abuse, or positive results of the drug and alcohol screen tests at screening or baseline
- Use of strong inhibitors of cytochrome P450 (CYP)3A4, as well as use of St John's Wort or strong inducers of CYP3A4 prohibited from 14 days before the administration of study drug until discharge from the clinic
- Smoking
- Average intake of more than 24 units of alcohol per week; Regular daily consumption of more than 1 L of methylxanthine-containing beverages
- Any condition, which may result in longer than usual retention of urine or feces in the body, such as pronounced (less than one defecation in 2 days) constipation or symptomatic prostatic hypertrophy.
- Participation in another mass balance study with a radiation burden > 0.1 mSv in the period of 1 year before screening
